original_text:
Dead or Alive 2
Dopo il grande successo del primo capitolo, la NetEnt si supera nuovamente proponendo il seguito di Dead or Alive. Anche in questo caso ci caliamo nell’atmosfera western, con una slot che gode di un upgrade grafico e tecnico non indifferente.
Ne parliamo in questa nostra recensione, analizzando prima uno e quindi l’altro aspetto.

Dead or Alive 2: un western tutto nuovo
Rispetto al primo Dead or Alive, questo secondo “capitolo” della slot ha un rinnovamento grafico di tutto rispetto.
L’ambientazione cupa è rimasta intatta, sebbene ora la cornice ci mostri un villaggio far west all’interno di un canyon e sia arricchita dai particolari di teschi bovini, bottiglie e ruote di carri. Per quanto alcuni simboli nella griglia di gioco siano rimasti invariati, seppur con un restyle grafico, come ad esempio la bottiglia di whisky, la stella da sceriffo, le revolver, gli stivali e il cappello arrivando anche ai simboli delle carte che mantengono lo stesso font tipico da saloon, in Dead or Alive 2 è stata introdotta una novità: i personaggi.
Infatti fra i vari simboli della slot troveremo anche dei personaggi ben distinti come ad  esempio la cowgirl, un losco brigante, l’avventuriero nativo americano e un giovane ladruncolo. Un particolare che è rimasto costante anche in Dead or Alive 2 è l’assenza di una vera e propria musica di sottofondo. Anche questa volta sono i suoni naturali a farla da padrone, come l’inconfondibile tempesta in arrivo, cigolii e cani che abbaiano. Solamente il suono di una chitarra stavolta irrompe nel silenzio tipico di un duello fra cowboy.
E dopo aver analizzato l’aspetto grafico e sonoro, passiamo invece a quello tecnico.

Dead or Alive 2: meccaniche di gioco
Proprio come il titolo precedente, anche in questo caso ci troviamo di fronte a una slot dal sapore classico sia nell’aspetto visivo che in quello tecnico. Dead or Alive 2 dimostra di essere una slot gemella a quella che l’aveva preceduta, almeno sulla carta: un meccanismo di gioco di tipo 5*3 corredato di 9 linee di vincita.
Le similitudini non si fermano anche per quanto riguarda le funzioni speciali del titolo, le quali ripercorrono la strada già tracciata dalla prima slot: i manifesti del ricercato ricoprono ancora una volta il ruolo di simboli Wild ed è inoltre possibile accedere alla modalità a giri gratuiti.
A queste si aggiungono molte altre modalità come l’Old Saloon e l’High Noon Saloon, che combinandosi con il simbolo Wild, rendono il gioco molto più variegato e divertente rispetto al predecessore.

Slot simili a Dead or Alive 2
Se dobbiamo parlare di alter slot che sfruttano il Western come tematica, iniziamo invitando a provare il titolo originale da cui è stato tratto questo seguito, ovvero Dead or Alive. Altre slot degne di menzione sono The Lovely Outlaws, Fandango’s 3 Weels e Ride ‘em Cowboy, alcune delle quali disponibili nella versione mobile per chi preferisce giocare nei momenti vuoti durante la giornata.

raw_translation.response:
Dead or Alive 2: A New Western Adventure

Following the huge success of the first installment, NetEnt has outdone themselves with the sequel, Dead or Alive 2. Once again, we find ourselves in a Western atmosphere, with a slot that boasts significant graphical and technical upgrades.

Let's delve into this review, analyzing each aspect in turn.

Dead or Alive 2: A Completely New Western Theme
Compared to the first Dead or Alive, this second slot boasts a considerable graphic overhaul. The dark atmosphere has remained intact; however, the frame now shows us a Far West village inside a canyon, enriched with distinctive details such as bovine skulls, bottles, and cart wheels. Although some symbols on the game grid have remained unchanged but with a graphical restyle, such as the whiskey bottle, sheriff's star, revolver, boots, and cowboy hat, even down to the symbols for playing cards that retain the typical saloon font, Dead or Alive 2 introduces a new feature: characters.

Among the various slot symbols, we find several well-defined characters, such as the cowgirl, a shady bandit, a Native American adventurer and a young thief. One constant aspect in Dead or Alive 2 is the absence of actual background music. Natural sounds dominate, such as an impending storm, creaks, and barking dogs, with only the sound of a guitar breaking into the typical silence of a cowboy duel.

After analyzing the graphic and sound aspects, let's move onto the technical details.

Dead or Alive 2: Gameplay Mechanics
Just like its predecessor, we have a slot with a classic flavor, both in terms of visual and technical aspects. Dead or Alive 2 proves to be a twin slot to its predecessor, at least on paper: a 5 * 3 game mechanism with 9 paylines.

The similarities don't end there - even the special features of the game are similar to the first slot. The Wanted posters once again represent the Wild symbols, and it's also possible to access the free spins mode. Additionally, several other modes are available, such as the Old Saloon and High Noon Saloon, which, combined with the Wild symbol, make gameplay even more varied and fun compared to the previous game.

Slots Similar to Dead or Alive 2
If we need to talk about other Western-themed slots, we recommend trying the original title from which this sequel was derived, Dead or Alive. Other noteworthy slots include The Lovely Outlaws, Fandango's 3 Weels, and Ride 'em Cowboy - some of which are available in the mobile version for those who prefer to play in their spare moments.

Review:
 
Gameplay mechanics

Dead or Alive 2 sticks to the classic slot game formula with a 5x3 reel setup and 9 paylines, much like its predecessor. Players can expect special features such as Wild symbols and free spins mode, alongside new modes like Old Saloon and High Noon Saloon. These additions make the game more exciting and give players more chances to win big.

Graphic and technical upgrades

Dead or Alive 2 has undergone significant graphic and technical upgrades, which are evident in its Western environment. The dark setting of the original is still present, but it now includes a Wild West village inside a canyon with detailed elements such as cattle skulls, bottles, and carriage wheels. Card symbols still use the typical saloon font, but well-defined characters such as a cowgirl, a shady bandit, a Native American adventurer, and a young thief have been introduced. Natural sounds like creaking, barking dogs, and storm approaching are present again, with the addition of the sound of a guitar during cowboy duels.

Western theme and environment

Dead or Alive 2 immerses players in a Western theme and environment with a dark setting that includes a Wild West village inside a canyon. The symbols on the reel include classic Western elements such as whiskey bottles, sheriff’s stars, revolvers, boots, hats, and well-defined characters like cowgirls, bandits, adventurers, and thieves. Natural sounds like creaking, barking dogs, and storm approaching are present in the game, with the sound of a guitar breaking the typical silence during cowboy duels.

Free spins mode

Dead or Alive 2 offers a free spins mode that players can access by landing three or more scatter symbols. There are three modes to choose from, including Old Saloon, High Noon Saloon, and Train Heist, which offer different multipliers and features that can help players win big. The free spins mode is an exciting addition that makes the game more varied and entertaining.

Comparable slots with similar Western themes

Players who enjoy the Western theme can enjoy other slots such as the original Dead or Alive and The Lovely Outlaws, Fandango’s 3 Wheels, and Ride 'em Cowboy. These slots offer similar Western elements and are available on mobile devices for players who prefer to play during their free time throughout the day.

Review: Dead or Alive 2:

After the huge success of the first release, NetEnt steps up the game with the sequel of Dead or Alive. Once again, we immerse ourselves in a Western environment, with a slot that has undergone significant graphic and technical upgrades.
We will discuss this in our review, first analyzing one aspect and then the other.

Dead or Alive 2: a whole new Western
Compared to the first Dead or Alive, this second "chapter" of the slot has a significant graphic renovation.
The dark setting is still intact, although now the frame shows us a Wild West village inside a canyon, enriched with the details of cattle skulls, bottles, and carriage wheels. While some symbols in the game grid have remained unchanged, albeit with a graphic restyling, such as the whiskey bottle, the sheriff’s star, the revolvers, the boots, and the hat, the symbols of the cards still keep the typical saloon font. In Dead or Alive 2, a novelty has been introduced: the characters.
In fact, among the various symbols of the slot, we also find well-defined characters such as the cowgirl, a shady bandit, a Native American adventurer, and a young thief. A particular aspect that has remained constant in Dead or Alive 2 is the absence of true background music. Once again, natural sounds take the lead, such as the unmistakable storm approaching, creaking, and barking dogs. Only the sound of a guitar breaks the typical silence of a cowboy duel this time.
After analyzing the graphic and sound aspect, let's move on to the technical one.

Dead or Alive 2: gameplay mechanics
Just like the previous title, in this case, too, we are facing a slot with a classic flavor, both in the visual and technical aspects. Dead or Alive 2 proves to be a twin slot to the one that preceded it, at least on paper: a 5*3 game mechanism accompanied by 9 paylines.
The similarities do not stop even regarding the special features of the title, which retrace the path already taken by the first slot: wanted posters once again play the role of Wild symbols, and it is also possible to access the free spins mode.
To these, many other modes are added, such as the Old Saloon and the High Noon Saloon, which, combined with the Wild symbol, make the game much more varied and entertaining than the predecessor.

Slots similar to Dead or Alive 2
If we have to talk about other slots that exploit the Western theme, we start by inviting you to try the original title from which this sequel was extracted, namely Dead or Alive. Other slots worth mentioning are The Lovely Outlaws, Fandango’s 3 Wheels, and Ride 'em Cowboy, some of which are available in the mobile version for those who prefer to play during their free time throughout the day.
